title: Physical Effects of Grief
description: A 60-second lesson on Physical Effects of Grief.

hook.text: Broken heart syndrome is real â€” grief can literally cause your heart to fail.

buildup.text: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy mimics a heart attack and is triggered by extreme emotional stress.

discovery.text: Grief suppresses the immune system, increasing vulnerability to illness for months.

twist.text: Bereaved spouses have a 41 percent higher mortality rate in the first six months.

climax.text: Cortisol floods the body during grief, disrupting sleep, appetite, and concentration.

punchline.text: The body grieves as intensely as the mind.

quiz.question: What is takotsubo cardiomyopathy?
options: A heart condition triggered by extreme grief or stress
